content: chain-free basic charity scarf pattern by tracie a neill of the crochet studio www thecrochetstudio com a basic crocheted scarf that takes little time and a minimal amount of yarn for more giving in a pattern that never goes out of style s kill level anyone who can double_crochet can make this scarf materials 7 oz worsted weight yarn in main color of choice mc small amount worsted weight yarn in coordinating color cc size h8/5 00mm crochet hook yarn needle for weaving in ends finished size 6 x 58 inches exact gauge is not important for this project however for best results there should be at least 3 double_crochet per inch and 1 75 row per inch anything less will result in a much smaller scarf anything more will result in a larger one abbreviations us terms chain = chain double_crochet = double_crochet fdc = foundation double_crochet see special stitches special stitches fdc foundation double_crochet chain 3 yo insert hook in 3rd chain from hook yo pull yarn through stitch yo pull through 1 loop on hook this is the first of the base chains yo pull through 2 loops on hook yo pull through last 2 loops this completes the first double_crochet *yo insert hook into base chain yo pull yarn through yo pull through 1 loop on hook yo pull through 2 loops on hook yo pull through last two loops on hook * repeat from * to * until desired number of stitches is completed pattern note the chain 3 turning chain at the beginning of each row always counts as the first double_crochet in that row instructions row 1 with mc work 20 fdc chain 3 turn 20 double_crochet row 2 double_crochet in each stitch across chain 3 turn row 3-4 repeat row 2 change to cc row 5-6 repeat row 2 change to mc row 7-8 repeat row 2 change to cc row 9-10 repeat row 2 change to mc row 11-92 repeat row 2 change to cc row 93-98 repeat row 5-10 change to mc row 99-102 repeat row 2 finish off and weave in ends give to your favorite charity or to someone in need of a little warmth and smile knowing you made a difference basic charity scarf copyright 2008 by tracie a neill & the crochet studio all rights reserved make as many of these scarves as you like to give away but do not reproduce this pattern whole or in part which includes but is not limited to posting it on a blog or web site do not claim this pattern as your own either directly or indirectly if you have any questions or comments please contact tracie at tracie@thecrochetstudio com thank you
